member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.RAPI.Connect
member.summary: Connects synchronously to the remote device

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.RAPI.Connect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connect asynchronously to the remote device with a timeout of 0 seconds
member.param: If true the method blocks until RAPI Initializes or throws an error. If false the contructor does not block and the RAPIConnected event signals successful device connection.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.RAPI.Connect(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connect asynchronously to the remote device with a timeout of 0 seconds
member.param: If true the method blocks until RAPI Initializes or throws an error. If false the contructor does not block and the RAPIConnected event signals successful device connection.

Asynchronous connections can be set to timeout after a set number of seconds. Synchronous connection wait infinitely by default (and underlying RAPI design). For asynchronous connections, a timeout value of -1 is infinite.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.RAPI.DeviceFileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a file exists on the connected remote device
member.param: Fully qualified path to the file or path on the device to test
member.returns: true if the file or directory exists, false if it does not

member.summary: Given a path to a shortcut, returns the full path to the shortcut's target
member.param: Path to the shortcut

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.RAPI.CreateDeviceShortcut(System.String,System.String)
member.param: The fully qualifed path name, including the .lnk extension, of the shortcut to create
Target path of the shortcut limited to 256 characters (use quoted string when target includes spaces)
member.example: The following statement creates a shortcut on the remote desktop for the Smart Device Authentication Utility: CreateDeviceShortcut("\\windows\\desktop\\.Net Debug.lnk", "\\windows\\sdauthutildevice.exe");

member.summary: Force an ActiveSync connection. Autoconnect must be disabled.

member.summary: Force an ActiveSync disconnect. Autoconnect must be disabled.

member.summary: Converts an integer into a dotted-string-notation IP address

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.Active
member.summary: Indicates that a connection is established between the client application and the connection manager.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.Answer
member.summary: Indicates that the Windows CE connection manager has detected the communications interface.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.Disconnect
member.summary: Indicates that the connection manager has terminated the connection between the desktop computer and the Windows CE朾ased device

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.Error
member.summary: Indicates that the connection manager failed to start communications between the desktop computer and the Windows CE朾ased device.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.Inactive
member.summary: Indicates a disconnection, or disconnected state, between the desktop computer and the Windows CE朾ased device.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.IPChange
member.summary: Indicates that an Internet Protocol (IP) address has been established for communication between the desktop computer and the Windows CE朾ased device.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.Listen
member.summary: Indicates that a connection is waiting to be established between the desktop computer and the Windows CE朾ased device.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.Terminated
member.summary: Indicates that the Windows CE connection manager has been shut down.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.ConnectAsGuestOnly
member.summary: When true, all CE devices connecting to the host will connect as guest without prompting for a partnership

member.summary: Gets or Sets an array of paths for applications that will be automatically run on the PC when a CE device is connected to the host PC

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.ActiveSync.AutoStartOnDisconnect
member.summary: Gets or Sets an array of paths for applications that will be automatically run on the PC when a CE device is connected to the host PC

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistry
member.summary: Supplies the base registry keys that access values and subkeys in the registry on the attached device.
member.remarks: This class was renamed from its previous name of "Registry" to avoid naming clashes with the desktop equivalent.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistry.LocalMachine
member.summary: Contains the configuration data for the local machine. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistry.CurrentUser
member.summary: Contains information about the current user preferences. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_USER.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistry.ClassesRoot
member.summary: Defines the types (or classes) of documents and the properties associated with those types. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistry.Users
member.summary: Contains information about the default user configuration. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_USERS.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey
member.summary: Represents a key level node in the device-side Windows registry. This class is a registry encapsulation.
member.remarks: This class was renamed from its previous name of "RegistryKey" to avoid naming clashes with the desktop equivalent.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.ToString
member.summary: Retrieves a string representation of this key.
member.returns: A string representing the key. If the specified key is invalid (cannot be found) then a null value is returned.
member.exception: The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.Close
member.summary: Closes the key and flushes it to storage if the contents have been modified.
member.remarks: Calling this method on system keys will have no effect, since system keys should never be closed. This method does nothing if you call it on an instance of RegistryKey that is already closed.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey. The string subKey is not case-sensitive.
member.remarks: This class was renamed from its previous name of "RegistryKey" to avoid naming clashes with the desktop equivalent, therefore the return type of this method has also been changed to .
member.param: Name or path of subkey to create or open.
member.returns: Returns the subkey, or null if the operation failed.
member.exception: The specified subkey is null.
The length of the specified subkey is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.OpenSubKey(System.String)
member.remarks: This class was renamed from its previous name of "RegistryKey" to avoid naming clashes with the desktop equivalent, therefore the return type of this method has also been changed to .
member.param: Name or path of subkey to open.
member.returns: The subkey requested, or null if the operation failed.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.OpenSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.remarks: This class was renamed from its previous name of "RegistryKey" to avoid naming clashes with the desktop equivalent, therefore the return type of this method has also been changed to .
member.param: Name or path of subkey to open.
Set to true if you need write access to the key.
member.returns: The subkey requested, or null if the operation failed.
member.exception: name is null.
The length of the specified subkey is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.DeleteSubKey(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey. The string subkey is not case-sensitive.
member.param: Name of the subkey to delete.
member.exception: The specified subkey is not a valid reference to a registry key.
The subkey is null.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.DeleteSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey. The string subkey is not case-sensitive.
member.param: Name of the subkey to delete.

Indicates whether an exception should be raised if the specified subkey cannot be found. If this argument is true and the specified subkey does not exist then an exception is raised. If this argument is false and the specified subkey does not exist, then no action is taken
member.exception: The specified subkey is not a valid reference to a registry key (and throwOnMissingSubKey is true).
The subkey is null.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.DeleteSubKeyTree(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a subkey and any child subkeys recursively. The string subKey is not case-sensitive.
member.param: Subkey to delete.
member.exception: The subkey parameter is null.
Deletion of a root hive is attempted. The subkey parameter does not match a valid registry subkey.
The being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.GetSubKeyNames
member.summary: Retrieves an array of strings that contains all the subkey names.
member.returns: An array of strings that contains the names of the subkeys for the current key.
member.exception: The being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.GetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the data associated with the specified value, or null if the value does not exist.
member.param: Name of the value to retrieve.
member.returns: The data associated with name , or null if the value does not exist.
member.exception: The RegistryKey being manipulated does not exist.
The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.GetValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified value, or the default value you provide if the specified value is not found.
member.param: Name of the value to retrieve.
Value to return if name does not exist.
member.returns: The data associated with name, or defaultValue if name is not found.
member.exception: The RegistryKey being manipulated does not exist.
The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.SetValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.param: Name of value to store data in.
Data to store.
member.exception: The length of the specified value is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
value is null.
The RegistryKey being set is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.DeleteValue(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified value from this key.
member.param: Name of the value to delete.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Desktop.Communication.CERegistryKey.DeleteValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the specified value from this key.
member.param: Name of the value to delete.

Indicates whether an exception should be raised if the specified value cannot be found. If this argument is true and the specified value does not exist then an exception is raised. If this argument is false and the specified value does not exist, then no action is taken
member.exception: name is not a valid reference to a value (and throwOnMissingValue is true) or name is null
The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.summary: Retrieves an array of strings that contains all the value names associated with this key.
member.returns: An array of strings that contains the value names for the current key.
member.exception: The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.summary: Retrieves the name of the key.
